trainerList.profileSummary:
I am Murtala Idris Abdurrauf who hailed from Birnin Gwari Local Government        Area of Kaduna State.

I started my primary school at Jibril Maigwari primary School from 1991 to 1997 where I obtained primary certificate. I preceded to Government secondary school in Birnin Gwari from 1997 to 2000, where I obtained Junior School Certificate. Later to Zamfara College Art and Science Gasau from 2000 to 2003, where I obtained secondary school certificate.

In 2005 to 2007   I attended Nuhu Bamalli Polytechnic Zaria where I obtained National Diploma in Civil Engineering. Furthermore, in 2009 I got admitted into Abubakar Tafawa Balewa University Bauchi to read Environmental Sciences where I obtained B.Tech degree in Environmental Management Technology in year of 2014.

I did my one year mandatory service i.e. NYSC in Minna Niger State.

I having been opportune to participate in N-Power Tech Program where I become chief instructor/trainee, I have assigned to take carpentry for the period of three (3) months, where we have both practical and theoretical often the period of training.

I also participated in the second batch of training for program from May to August, 2019 as a chief instructor to train both theoretical and practical aspect. I also assigned to supervise trainees/Artisans during the three (3) months period of their attachment to see how each artisan performed in the practical work.

trainerList.profileSummary:
Muhammad Lawal Abubakar, I was born on the 20th December,1986. I started my carrier with Nuril Islam Primary School Birnin Gwari between 1989 - 1994 where i obtained primary school leaving certificate. 

I attended Government Day Junior Secondary School Kuyello from 1994 - 1997 where i obtained junior school  certficate.  I then continued with my education at Science Secondary School, Birnin Gwari from 1997 - 2000 where i obtained senior school certificate.

I proceed to School of Health and Technology, Kankia of Katsina state from 2000 - 2002 where i obtained a Certificate in Environmental Health Assistant. 

I was able to attend Shehu Idris College of Health Sciences and Technology, Makarfi kaduna state where i gained Diploma in Environmental Health Technician from 2004 - 2007.

I then proceed to prestigious University of Abubakar Tafawa Balewa University, Bauchi from 2008 -2015 where i was been awarded the Degree of Bachelor of Technology ( Urban and Regional Planning ). I did my One year mandatory  National Service from 27th October 2015 to 26th October 2016, in accordance with Section 11 of the National Youth Service Corps Act, Cap N84, LFN 2004.

 

Furthermore, during the service year, i did my Community Development Service (CDS) with Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)/ NYSC Advocacy Project.

However, i was able to undertake 3 months Certificate Courses with Project Management Professional Institute in two various aspect, namely:

I. Project Management Professional Certificate (PMP).

II. Health, Safety and Environment Management (HSE) respectively.

I was also able to secure an admission into Kaduna State University as a post graduate student between 2016 - 2018 where i obtained Post Graduate Diploma ( Geographic Information Science ). 

And during the course we were able to participate in One Week Intensive Hands-on Training on Remote Sensing and GIS in November 2017 organized by National Space Research and Development Agency (NASRDA) Lugbe, Abuja. In collaboration with Kaduna State University.

I participated in the first batch CORBON /N – POWER UP skilling training at BATC Kauru, Kaduna State from January – March 2019, where I serve as an instructor for painting and decoration trade.

I also participated in the second batch of the training N – POWER BUILD training from May – August, 2019. However, I supervised the artisans/trainees at various places of their industrial training.

trainerList.profileSummary:
Auwal Abdullahi, I was born on 29th June, 1985 I started my carrier in Education with Jibril Maigwari Primary School, Birnin – Gwari from 1991  to 1997

I started my primary school at Jibril Maigwari primary School from 1991 to 1997 where I obtained primary certificate. I preceded to Government secondary school in Birnin Gwari from 1997 t0 2000, where I obtained Junior School Certificate. Later to Government Technical College, Kaguru  from 2000 to 2003, where I obtained secondary school certificate.

In 2003 to 2004   I attended Technical Staff Training Institute, Kaduna where I obtained National Diploma in Estate Management 2005 – 2007. Furthermore, in 2012 I obtained my certificate in Business Apprenticeship Training Centre, Kauru. I proceed to  Abubakar Tafawa Balewa University Bauchi to study  Building Education Technology  I obtained B.Tech degree in 2018.

I have attended various workshop relating to  CORBON/N- POWER, with opportune to participate in N-Power Tech Program where I become a Centre Head and  chief instructor/trainee in Masonry and tailing, I have assigned to take trainees on Masonry and Tailing  for the period of three (3) months, where we have both practical and theoretical often the period of training.

I also participated in the second batch of training for program from May to August, 2019 as centre head/chief instructor to train both theoretical and practical aspect. I also assigned to supervise trainees/Artisans during the three (3) months period of their attachment to see how each artisan performed in the practical work.                               

I participated in the first batch CORBON /N – POWER UP skilling training at BATC Kauru, Kaduna State from January – March 2019, where I serve as Centre Head to supervised all the  instructor in the various trade.

I also participated in the second batch of the training N – POWER BUILD training from May – August, 2019. However, I served as a Centre Head to supervised all the artisans/trainees and the instructor at various places of their industrial training.

trainerList.techSkills:
Carpenters require math skills in order to accurately measure materials that need to be cut and installed. They also use their math skills to plan projects – this might include reading blueprints and making measurements, as well as calculating costs to make sure the project comes in under budget. Frequently used math skills include arithmetic, algebra, geometry, and even calculus and statistics.

  • Budgeting
  • Geometry
  • Algebra
  • Estimates
  • Marking
  • Measuring
